fields_of_interest: Education and training, Business and Industry, Single market, Research and innovation, Public Health, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives: FP7, Horizon2020, FP9, ESFRI, Digital Single Market, ERA, structural funds, European Open Science Cloud, European Data Economy, Skills Agenda, Erasmus+, European Interoperability Framework, eGovernment Action Plan, eHealth
organisation_name: CSC - IT Center for Science Ltd. (CSC)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: CSC - IT Center for Science Ltd. is a non-profit company, owned by the state of Finland and Finnish universities and universities of applied sciences. CSC is administered by the Finnish Ministry of Education and Culture. CSC as part of the national research system develops, integrates and offers high-quality ICT services for research, education, culture, public administration and companies. CSC operations are guided by values which reflect its social responsibility: responsibly, together, with care and expertise. These values are enforced as the basis for sustainable operations that take account of the relationship between economic activities and ecological, social and cultural values. CSC's strategic targets include: 1) Enable world-class data management and computing, 2) Maximize the value of data, 3) Leverage artificial intelligence and 4) Pave the way for lifelong learning. CSC has offices in Espoo's Keilaniemi and in the Renforsin Ranta business park in Kajaani.
